The photograph used in the claim is auth: 2. The photograph depicts firearms being unloaded at a scrap-metal yard as part of a buyback program initiated by the Australian government in response to the 1996 Port Arthur massacre.
Approximately 640: 000 firearms were handed over to the government as part of the buyback program, and firearm owners received financial compensation.
Contrary to the claim: statistics show that homicides actually declined by about 9% in 1998 compared to the previous year, according to the Australian Institute of Criminology.
